      • addOnClickListeners

        public void addOnClickListeners()
        This method is designed to enable the user interface to be interactive. It first locates the UI elements (Buttons) and correct associates them with the desired onClickListener and resulting action. Any newly added UI elements that require onClickEvents should be handled within this method.

      • getPois

        public static java.util.Vector<PointOfInterest> getPois()
        Retrieve static Vector to store all the walks locations. This is static so it can easily be accessed by other activities, without having to pass around large amounts of data through intents
        Returns:
        Vector - the Vector which stores the walks locations

      • addPOIToMap

        public void addPOIToMap(PointOfInterest p)
        This method adds points of interest to the GoogleMap based on the devices current GPS coordinates. It also creates a BitMap image based on the image file associated with the PointOfInterest and assigns this image to a GoogleMap Marker. This Marker is then displayed on the map with the relevant information
        Parameters:
        PointOfInterest - - The location which you want to add to the map

      • getResizedBitmap

        public android.graphics.Bitmap getResizedBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                       int resultHeight,
                                       int resultWidth)
        The method resizes a bitmap based on the given parameters. This is used when creating the Bitmap for the GoogleMap Marker as a full size image returned is far too big to comfortably fit on the GoogleMap.
        Parameters:
        Bitmap - - the Bitmap you wish to resize
        int - - the resulting height of the resized Bitmap
        int - - the resulting width of the resized Bitmap
        Returns:
        Bitmap - the resulting resized Bitmap

      • startCountingTimer

        public void startCountingTimer()
        This method is used to track the amount of time elapsed during the walk. This method uses the runnable interfaces to execute an incremental timer every second, to give the illusion that there is an actual clock running. It uses the systems time in milliseconds to perform is basic calculations using the division and modulus operators. The result of this calculate is then converted into the String format so it can easily be passed around, and easily be split back into integer or floating points.

      • getTimeStamp

        public java.lang.String getTimeStamp()
        Returns the current elapsed time for the walk.
        Returns:
        String - the current time stamp

      • stopTimer

        public void stopTimer()
        Stops the timer from executing, by updating the stop condition to be true.

      • deleteWalk

        public void deleteWalk()
        Deleting the waking is a functional requirement. In order to achieve this you have to clear the GoogleMap, delete all elements from the Vector and reset all of the walks variables to empty Strings, as well as stopping the timer. Any new variables/walk credentials that need to be deleted must be added to this method.

        public void onDestroy()
        Overrides:
        onDestroy in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
